intro: Bidens andicola f. buchtienii, commonly known as the Andean ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cooler and drier conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and narrow, while the flowers are small and yellow with prominent central disks. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its hardy nature and attractive foliage.
